tidy glm

Source: R/tidyModels.R
tidy_glm.Rd

Runs either a linear regression, logistic regression, or multinomial classification. The model is automatically determined based off the nature of the target variable.

tidy_glm(data, formula)

Arguments

data

dataframe
formula

formula

Value

glm model

Examples


# linear regression
iris %>%
tidy_glm(
tidy_formula(., target = Petal.Width))

#> 
#> Call:  stats::glm(formula = formula, family = glm_family, data = data)
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#>       (Intercept)       Sepal.Length        Sepal.Width       Petal.Length  
#>          -0.47314           -0.09293            0.24220            0.24220  
#> Speciesversicolor   Speciesvirginica  
#>           0.64811            1.04637  
#> 
#> Degrees of Freedom: 149 Total (i.e. Null);  144 Residual
#> Null Deviance:	    86.57 
#> Residual Deviance: 3.998 	AIC: -104.1

# multinomial classification
iris %>%
tidy_glm(
tidy_formula(., target = Species))

#> Call:
#> nnet::multinom(formula = Species ~ Sepal.Length + Sepal.Width + 
#>     Petal.Length + Petal.Width, data = list(c(5.1, 4.9, 4.7,

#  logistic regression
iris %>%
dplyr::filter(Species != "versicolor") %>%
tidy_glm(
tidy_formula(., target = Species))

#> 
#> Call:  stats::glm(formula = formula, family = glm_family, data = data)
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#>  (Intercept)  Sepal.Length   Sepal.Width  Petal.Length   Petal.Width  
#>      -15.168        -3.961        -4.172        11.975         9.736  
#> 
#> Degrees of Freedom: 99 Total (i.e. Null);  95 Residual
#> Null Deviance:	    138.6 
#> Residual Deviance: 8.583e-10 	AIC: 10
